post.author: 2cimarafa
post.title: Alcohol Is Simply the Superior Drug

div.p: Often unsaid, the reason alcohol is so great is because it simply is the superior drug, something that becomes more clear to me the more I think about it.

I honestly prefer alcohol to practically every other drug I can think of, including prescription painkillers, cocaine, LSD, shrooms, MDMA and most of all weed, which I find immensely boring and the preserve of shitty, dull people. If you offered me a glass of decent wine or a line of (perfect quality) coke, I literally can’t think of any occasion in the last decade I’d voluntarily pick the latter.

Alcohol is loved not just because it’s legal, but because it's the best. To me, weed just makes me feel dazed. Coke makes me a shitty, overly loud conversationalist of unwarranted confidence. Psychedelics take me out of myself in a way I find fundamentally disconcerting. Molly gives me a fake feeling of empathy that leaves me a little dirty afterward.

Alcohol makes me happy, works in small doses (you don’t need to be drunk/‘high’ on alcohol, or even remotely close, to enjoy it significantly), lubricates conversation without being excessive, delivers its effect quickly and for a decent period without overstaying its welcome and involves a variety of interesting flavors and tastes that add to the experience. Great wines belong with great food. A crisp, light beer after a long day of walking or working. A cocktail against a summer sunset. To me these are the pleasures of life that make alcohol so much better than other drugs that I’ve tried.
Naturally the best drug will be stickier. It’s the best. Only those who somehow fail to appreciate this obvious fact end up succumbing to other substances.
